abstracts.cdata!:
The Conservation of Priority Protected
            Areas Project consists of a sector adjustment program based
            on policy and institutional reforms, and an investment
            project in support of institutional strengthening and
            regional community-based resource management activities. The
            sector adjustment program will:  (a) determine what areas of
            the Philippines must be preserved undisturbed and introduce
            an effective management system; (b) impose user fees for
            public resources which discourage rent-seeking behavior; (c)
            improve enforcement of logging regulations; (d) provide
            secure tenure rights to users in return for sustainable
            resource use; (e) provide extension services to upland
            populations; and (f) establish mechanisms for support of
            community-based resource management and livelihood projects.
            The investment component will finance:  (a) the design of an
            integrated protected areas system; (b) program support for
            management of ten priority protected areas; (c) improved
            monitoring of logging operations and enforcement of forestry
            laws and regulations through the provision of equipment,
            training and technical assistance; (d) development in four
            regions of the capacity of local governments and line
            agencies to generate and service small-scale community-based
            resource management and livelihood projects in watershed
            areas, combining community organizing and pre-cooperatives
            development; resource management; introduction of
            sustainable means of livelihood and improvement in tenure.
